search_information.query_displayed: Classroom Composition and Achievement Gains. Leiter, Jeffrey Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Classroom composition and achievement gains
organic_results.snippet: This paper examines the effects on reading and mathematics learning of the composition of classrooms, focusing on student abilities represented in classrooms. Data drawn from district records describe one cohort of students as they passed through the third grade. Classroom ability composition is conceptualized in terms of the level and homogeneity of ability in a classroom and the interaction between the two. The higher the mean class ability level, the greater the mathematics gains of the students in the class, but the smaller the reading gains …

publication_info.summary: J Leiter - Sociology of Education, 1983 - JSTOR
